AFTERMATH.Definition: the period after a significant unpleasant event

BOMBER.Definition: an aircraft designed to carry and drop bombs

RESPECTIVELY.Definition: in a way that relates to each of the two cities in the order already mentioned

NUCLEAR FISSION.Definition: the process of splitting the nucleus to create a powerful reaction

IN THE LONG RUN.Definition: after a long period of time

MAINLAND.Definition: the main part of the country, not including the islands

KAMIKAZE.Definition: Japanese pilots trained to make suicidal crash attacks on enemy ships

LET’S BE FRANK.Definition: let's be honest or speak the truth

AT FIRST GLANCE.Definition: when seen briefly and for the first time

COMMITTEE.Definition: a group of people organised to make decisions

NEUTRAL.Definition: not belonging to either of the two sides

BLOCKADE.Definition: closing off or surrounding of a place by hostile ships or troops to stop entrance or exit of goods or people

CONCENTRATED.Definition: intense, involving a lot of effort

SYMBOLIC.Definition: serving as a representation or symbol of their power

MINIMISED.Definition: reduced to the least possible level

EXAGGERATION.Definition: something said to make it look more important than it really is

DEHUMANISATION.Definition: treating them as less than human or not having human qualities

JUSTIFY.Definition: show that it was reasonable or right

ON THE VERGE OF.Definition: at the point when they were about to

TRACED BACK.Definition: identified as having its origins or beginning

PANDORA’S BOX.Definition: something that once begun creates a lot of new problems (Greek mythology)
